intro: Caiophora macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered caiophora, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and branching. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks.
